document_data.name: Luposphinx
document_data.refs1e: {{Cite dragon/119/The Dragon's Bestiary: A walk through the woods|49-50}}
document_data.mainbody: '''Luposphinxes''' were a rare subspecies of [[sphinx]] distinguished by their [[wolf]]-like heads.
document_data.Description: Luposphinxes were, like other sphinxes, largely leonine in form, about {{SI|7|ft|long=yes}} in length, with feathered wings. Their wolvish heads set them apart from other sphinxes. The fur ranged from dark brown to light grey in color.
document_data.Personality: Luposphinxes were very intelligent but evil creatures that acted according to their desires.
document_data.Abilities: Twice each day, luposphinxes could emit a frightful howl that could deafen and even panic creatures within {{SI|60|ft}} of them.
document_data.Combat: When a luposphinx got into a fight, they preferred to start with a howl, followed by melee attacks with their front claws and powerful jaws.
document_data.Ecology: Luposphinxes lived in forested areas. They were generally solitary, although some were known to be served by [[xvart]]s or [[gnoll]]s. They were also carnivorous and were known to prey on humanoids; luposphinxes preferred the flesh of [[elf|elves]] and [[halfling]]s.
